str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To show forth, prove. From en and deiknuo; to indicate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, altogether. Absolutely all or every one.
Patience, forbearance, longsuffering. From the same as makrothumos; longanimity, i.e. forbearance or fortitude.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
A pattern, example; a form, sample. From a compound of hupo and a derivative of tupos; typification under, i.e. a sketch for imitation.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: A strengthened form of melo; to intend, i.e. Be about to be, do, or suffer something.
From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From aion; perpetual.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.
